017package org.apache.juneau.cp;
018
019import static org.apache.juneau.collections.JsonMap.*;
020import static org.apache.juneau.common.utils.IOUtils.*;
021import static org.apache.juneau.common.utils.Utils.*;
022import static org.apache.juneau.internal.FileUtils.*;
023
024import java.io.*;
025import java.util.*;
026import java.util.ResourceBundle.*;
027import java.util.concurrent.*;
028import java.util.regex.*;
029
030import org.apache.juneau.common.utils.*;
031import org.apache.juneau.internal.*;
032
033/**
034 * Basic implementation of a {@link FileFinder}.
035 *
036 * <p>
037 * Specialized behavior can be implemented by overridding the {@link #find(String, Locale)} method.
038 *
039 * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
040 * <p class='bjava'>
041 *    <jk>public class</jk> MyFileFinder <jk>extends</jk> BasicFileFinder {
042 *       <ja>@Override</ja>
043 *       <jk>protected</jk> Optional&lt;InputStream&gt; find(String <jv>name</jv>, Locale <jv>locale</jv>) <jk>throws</jk> IOException {
044 *          <jc>// Do special handling or just call super.find().</jc>
045 *          <jk>return super</jk>.find(<jv>name</jv>, <jv>locale</jv>);
046 *       }
047 *    }
048 * </p>
049 *
050 * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
051 * </ul>
052 */
053public class BasicFileFinder implements FileFinder {
054
055   private static final ResourceBundle.Control RB_CONTROL = ResourceBundle.Control.getControl(Control.FORMAT_DEFAULT);
056
057   private final Map<String,LocalFile> files = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
058   private final Map<Locale,Map<String,LocalFile>> localizedFiles = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
059
060   private final LocalDir[] roots;
061   private final long cachingLimit;
062   private final Pattern[] include, exclude;
063   private final String[] includePatterns, excludePatterns;
064   private final int hashCode;
065
066   /**
067    * Builder-based constructor.
068    *
069    * @param builder The builder object.
070    */
071   public BasicFileFinder(FileFinder.Builder builder) {
072      this.roots = builder.roots.toArray(new LocalDir[builder.roots.size()]);
073      this.cachingLimit = builder.cachingLimit;
074      this.include = builder.include;
075      this.exclude = builder.exclude;
076      this.includePatterns = alist(include).stream().map(Pattern::pattern).toArray(String[]::new);
077      this.excludePatterns = alist(exclude).stream().map(Pattern::pattern).toArray(String[]::new);
078      this.hashCode = HashCode.of(getClass(), roots, cachingLimit, includePatterns, excludePatterns);
079   }
080
081   /**
082    * Default constructor.
083    *
084    * <p>
085    * Can be used when providing a subclass that overrides the {@link #find(String, Locale)} method.
086    */
087   protected BasicFileFinder() {
088      this.roots = new LocalDir[0];
089      this.cachingLimit = -1;
090      this.include = new Pattern[0];
091      this.exclude = new Pattern[0];
092      this.includePatterns = new String[0];
093      this.excludePatterns = new String[0];
094      this.hashCode = HashCode.of(getClass(), roots, cachingLimit, includePatterns, excludePatterns);
095   }
096
097   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
098   // FileFinder methods
099   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
100
101   @Override /* FileFinder */
102   public final Optional<InputStream> getStream(String name, Locale locale) throws IOException {
103      return find(name, locale);
104   }
105
106   @Override /* FileFinder */
107   public Optional<String> getString(String name, Locale locale) throws IOException {
108      return Utils.opt(read(find(name, locale).orElse(null)));
109   }
110
111   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
112   // Implementation methods
113   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
114
115   /**
116    * The main implementation method for finding files.
117    *
118    * <p>
119    * Subclasses can override this method to provide their own handling.
120    *
121    * @param name The resource name.
122    *    See {@link Class#getResource(String)} for format.
123    * @param locale
124    *    The locale of the resource to retrieve.
125    *    <br>If <jk>null</jk>, won't look for localized file names.
126    * @return The resolved resource contents, or <jk>null</jk> if the resource was not found.
127    * @throws IOException Thrown by underlying stream.
128    */
129   protected Optional<InputStream> find(String name, Locale locale) throws IOException {
130      name = StringUtils.trimSlashesAndSpaces(name);
131
132      if (isInvalidPath(name))
133         return Utils.opte();
134
135      if (locale != null)
136         localizedFiles.putIfAbsent(locale, new ConcurrentHashMap<>());
137
138      Map<String,LocalFile> fileCache = locale == null ? files : localizedFiles.get(locale);
139
140      LocalFile lf = fileCache.get(name);
141
142      if (lf == null) {
143         List<String> candidateFileNames = getCandidateFileNames(name, locale);
144         paths: for (LocalDir root : roots) {
145            for (String cfn : candidateFileNames) {
146               lf = root.resolve(cfn);
147               if (lf != null)
148                  break paths;
149            }
150         }
151
152         if (lf != null && isIgnoredFile(lf.getName()))
153            lf = null;
154
155         if (lf != null) {
156            fileCache.put(name, lf);
157
158            if (cachingLimit >= 0) {
159               long size = lf.size();
160               if (size > 0 && size <= cachingLimit)
161                  lf.cache();
162            }
163         }
164      }
165
166      return Utils.opt(lf == null ? null : lf.read());
167   }
168
169   /**
170    * Returns the candidate file names for the specified file name in the specified locale.
171    *
172    * <p>
173    * For example, if looking for the <js>"MyResource.txt"</js> file in the Japanese locale, the iterator will return
174    * names in the following order:
175    * <ol>
176    *    <li><js>"MyResource_ja_JP.txt"</js>
177    *    <li><js>"MyResource_ja.txt"</js>
178    *    <li><js>"MyResource.txt"</js>
179    * </ol>
180    *
181    * <p>
182    * If the locale is <jk>null</jk>, then it will only return <js>"MyResource.txt"</js>.
183    *
184    * @param fileName The name of the file to get candidate file names on.
185    * @param locale
186    *    The locale.
187    *    <br>If <jk>null</jk>, won't look for localized file names.
188    * @return An iterator of file names to look at.
189    */
190   protected List<String> getCandidateFileNames(final String fileName, final Locale locale) {
191
192      if (locale == null)
193         return Collections.singletonList(fileName);
194
195      List<String> list = new ArrayList<>();
196      String baseName = getBaseName(fileName);
197      String ext = getExtension(fileName);
198
199      getCandidateLocales(locale).forEach(x -> {
200         String ls = x.toString();
201         if (ls.isEmpty())
202            list.add(fileName);
203         else {
204            list.add(baseName + "_" + ls + (ext.isEmpty() ? "" : ('.' + ext)));
205            list.add(ls.replace('_', '/') + '/' + fileName);
206         }
207      });
208
209      return list;
210   }
211
212   /**
213    * Returns the candidate locales for the specified locale.
214    *
215    * <p>
216    * For example, if <c>locale</c> is <js>"ja_JP"</js>, then this method will return:
217    * <ol>
218    *    <li><js>"ja_JP"</js>
219    *    <li><js>"ja"</js>
220    *    <li><js>""</js>
221    * </ol>
222    *
223    * @param locale The locale to get the list of candidate locales for.
224    * @return The list of candidate locales.
225    */
226   protected List<Locale> getCandidateLocales(Locale locale) {
227      return RB_CONTROL.getCandidateLocales("", locale);
228   }
229
230   /**
231    * Checks for path malformations such as use of <js>".."</js> which can be used to open up security holes.
232    *
233    * <p>
234    * Default implementation returns <jk>true</jk> if the path is any of the following:
235    * <ul>
236    *    <li>Is blank or <jk>null</jk>.
237    *    <li>Contains <js>".."</js> (to prevent traversing out of working directory).
238    *    <li>Contains <js>"%"</js> (to prevent URI trickery).
239    * </ul>
240    *
241    * @param path The path to check.
242    * @return <jk>true</jk> if the path is invalid.
243    */
244   protected boolean isInvalidPath(String path) {
245      return Utils.isEmpty(path) || path.contains("..") || path.contains("%");
246   }
247
248   /**
249    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if the file should be ignored based on file name.
250    *
251    * @param name The name to check.
252    * @return <jk>true</jk> if the file should be ignored.
253    */
254   protected boolean isIgnoredFile(String name) {
255      for (Pattern p : exclude)
256         if (p.matcher(name).matches())
257            return true;
258      for (Pattern p : include)
259         if (p.matcher(name).matches())
260            return false;
261      return true;
262   }
263
264   @Override
265   public int hashCode() {
266      return hashCode;
267   }
268
269   @Override /* Object */
270   public boolean equals(Object o) {
271      return o instanceof BasicFileFinder && Utils.eq(this, (BasicFileFinder)o, (x,y)->Utils.eq(x.hashCode, y.hashCode) && Utils.eq(x.getClass(), y.getClass()) && Utils.eq(x.roots, y.roots) && Utils.eq(x.cachingLimit, y.cachingLimit) && Utils.eq(x.includePatterns, y.includePatterns) && Utils.eq(x.excludePatterns, y.excludePatterns));
272   }
273
274   @Override /* Object */
275   public String toString() {
276      return filteredMap()
277         .append("class", getClass().getSimpleName())
278         .append("roots", roots)
279         .append("cachingLimit", cachingLimit)
280         .append("include", includePatterns)
281         .append("exclude", excludePatterns)
282         .append("hashCode", hashCode)
283         .asReadableString();
284   }
285}
